page.title: 06Bondleigh Farm. Arable
page.content: {Grass}grown in large quantities, strip grazed by milking cows, controlled by electric fencing. Largest proportion of grass yield made into{silage}on dairy farms for winter feeding of herds.{Hay}made in smaller quantities mostly by farmers with sheep or other livestock, ie. beef cattle.{Cereals. } Barley is main cereal, small quantity of oats, whilst wheat is gaining popularity for production of grain and reed used for rethatching houses. Large proportion home grown cereal retained on farm for home milling and mixing.{Potatoes.}Enough grown by most farms for own consumption.{Seed}is produced by one or two growers under strict regulations. Early and maincrop varieties are grown.{Harvesting}is by mechanical digger and picking up by hand or elevating harvester. Seed sold through merchants and garden centres.
